Design Notes.title: Setup
Design Notes.content: Initial project setup; includes the creation of any utility classes.

children.title: Font preload
children.content: The game font will be preloaded in the Scene Controller.

design.code:
// load the theme fonts
this.load.bitmapFont("[theme-font-import]", "/phaser/assets/font/[theme-font-import].png", "/phaser/assets/font/[theme-font-import].xml");

children.title: First Scene
children.content: The First Scene displayed will be the Akalabeth Character Creation Scene.  This is done in the Scene Controller 'create' method. A line will be added assigning the initial state. It will be the LAST line in the 'create' method.

design.code:
// set current scene
_switch(RetroC64Constants.AKALABETH_CHARACTER_CREATION);

children.title: Config File Imports
children.content:
The Config file will import the following classes:

* Akalabeth Controller
* Akalabeth World

children.title: Game States
children.content: The game will have several states available to it.  The first state will be AKALABETH_CHARACTER_CREATION.

elements.elementDefinition: The Character Creation state, where the player's character is created.
The Equipment Shop state, where the Shop view is displayed after character creation.
The Setup state, where the world is populated.
The World Map state, where the world map is displayed.
The Character Stats state, where the character stats screen is displayed.
The Dungeon state, where the dungeon exploration screen is displayed.
The Castle state, where the castle screen is displayed.
The Game Over state, where the game over screen is displayed.

children.title: Game Views
children.content: The game will have several views that change during play.

elements.elementDefinition: the first character creation state is for the player's lucky number entry
the second character creation state is for the player's desired level of play
the third character creation state is to review the character
the fourth character creation state is to select the character's class

the scene instances displayed during the level of play capture
the scene instances displayed during the character review process
the scene instances displayed during the character class selection phase

children.title: Scene Initial State
children.content: The Scene Container initial state is set in the 'create' method of the Scene Controller class. It will be set to the following state:

design.code:
// set initial state for Character Creation
[app-handle]AkalabethCharacterCreationScene.state = [app-handle]Constants.AKALABETH_CHARACTER_CREATION_LUCKY_NUMBER;

children.title: The Character Creation Interface
children.content:
A UI for the character creation process. This UI will handle the four steps in the process:

* getting the player's lucky number
* getting the game's level of play
* rolling a new character
* selecting the player's class

While this is happening, a 'Wait' message will appear on-screen. The UI scene will play for 10 cycles before moving on the the World Map.

children.title: Public Members
children.content: Occasionally, a UI Scene will need some further public members added.  This UI has added the following public members:

children.title: The Player's Location
children.content: The player's location on the world map is represented by crosshairs. This will be displayed above all world terrain in the center of the map.  The crosshairs' position will never change.

children.title: Draw World Map
children.content: A member will be needed for rendering the world map.

children.title: Render Polygon
children.content: A member will be added to quickly render a polygon.

design.memberDefinition:
/**
 * Renders a polygon based on the supplied points.
 * @param {string | Array.<number> | Array} List of points defining the perimeter of this Polygon
 */

children.title: Render Terrain Features
children.content:
Several members will define ways to quickly render different world features.  These include:

* mountains
* castles
* shops
* dungeons
* unknown

children.title: Crop Borders
children.content: A method will be added to crop the map's borders

design.memberDefinition:
/**
 * Crops the right and bottom edges of the map display.
 * @param {Number} percent the percentage of the image to display
 */

children.title: Map Animations
children.content:
The World Map will have several animations to display in response to user input. These animations include:

* Moving North
* Moving East
* Moving South
* Moving West

children.title: Key Listeners
children.content: The UI class will have key listeners for the following views:

children.title: Default Key Listener
children.content: The key listener will listen for valid commands.

children.title: Updates to the 'create' methods
children.content: The UI class will have the following updates to the 'create' method:

children.title: Scene start/reset
children.content: When the UI scene is started/reset, the following changes are applied for each view:

children.title: Public Members
children.content: Occasionally, a UI Scene will need some further public members added.  This UI has added the following public members:

children.title: Move Cursor
children.content: A public member will be created to handle moving the cursor after a command has been accepted. The cursor will be moved to the end of the command prompt line.

children.title: Move North
children.content: A member will be added to handle the player choosing to move northwards

children.title: Move South
children.content: A member will be added to handle the player command to move south.

children.title: Move East
children.content: A member will be added to handle the player command to move east.

children.title: Move West
children.content: A member will be added to handle the player command to move west.

children.title: Record History
children.content: A member will be added to record the history of the user's command on-screen

children.title: Character Watcher
children.content: This interface will watch the character instance and update the view when the character updates.

design.memberDefinition:
/**
 * Handles updates to a Watchable instance.
 * @param {Watchable} data the Watchable instance being updated
 */

children.title: Eating Food
children.content: A member to have the player eat food after every action will be added.

children.title: Set Commands
children.content: A public member to tell the UI to set the display of available commands will be added

children.title: Invalid Command Animation
children.content: A member to handle the moments when the player enters an invalid command is needed.

children.title: Clearing the scene
children.content: A member used for clearing the scene will be added.

children.title: Updates to the 'update' method.
children.content:
Updates will be made to the 'update' method to perform various tasks during each cycle.  These include:

* updating the command display

children.title: The Character Stats View
children.content: The Player can view their character's stats through the Character Stats view.

children.title: The Scene Container Class
children.content: A Scene Container class will need to be defined.  The Scene Container template will be used.

design.classDefinition: The Player can view their character's stats through the Character Stats view.

children.content:
The Game class will include the Scene Container as a required import.
The Scene Container class will require the following imports:

children.title: Postboot Processing
children.content: The Scene Container class will need to be added to the Game class postboot processing.

design.code: _game.scene.queueOp("start", "AkalabethCharacterStatsScene");

children.title: Scene Key
children.content: The Scene Container class will need to be added to the scene groups in the Scene Controller class.

children.title: Scene states
children.content: A State Group will need to be added to the App Constants for this Scene Container

elements.elementDefinition: The main state for the Character Stats scene

design.dictionaryDefinition: the scene instances displayed during the character stats scene

children.title: Scene Initial State
children.content: The Scene Container initial state is set in the 'create' method of the Scene Controller class. It will be set to the following state:

design.code:
// set initial state for Character Stats
[app-handle]AkalabethCharacterStatsScene.state = [app-handle]Constants.AKALABETH_CHARACTER_STATS_MAIN;
